newsitem.title: USA: NFL AMERICAN FOOTBALL-EMMITT SMITH JOKES ABOUT SCARY INJURY AFTER TESTS NEGATIVE.
newsitem.headline: NFL AMERICAN FOOTBALL-EMMITT SMITH JOKES ABOUT SCARY INJURY AFTER TESTS NEGATIVE.

text.p: Dallas Cowboys running back Emmitt Smith, back home Tuesday after a scary injury the night before in Chicago, was able to joke about it after tests found no serious damage.

Smith was injured Monday night with under four minutes to go in a 22-6 loss to the Chicago Bears when he dove across the scrimmage line as a decoy and landed awkwardly on his helmet and shoulder pads.
"I did it to myself, no one else did it to me," Smith said with a laugh after a serious of tests proved negative for a variety of permanent, serious injuries such as brain or spine damage.
Smith was immobilized, carted off the field and kept overnight at Chicago's Northwestern Memorial Hospital before returning to Dallas in the private jet of Cowboys owner Jerry Jones.
Still wearing a neck brace and his hospital clothes -- including turquoise-blue cloth shoes -- Smith told a Chicago television station of his frightening injury.

"I had a lot of pain shooting through the back. I started moving at first. All of a sudden my left arm went numb and my left leg started going numb. From that perspective, that's when I got scared -- when I couldn't feel my fingers, my leg."
Smith joked about the hospital shoes but added: "That was a serious time for me."
Smith was to be examined daily, but various broadcast reports said doctors considered it unlikely he would be ready to play Sunday when the Cowboys host the New York Giants,
Jones said Smith did not suffer any serious injuries but still had a sore neck and back. The owner would not rule out a return to the lineup Sunday.
"Emmitt will play, but whether or not he will play this week we don't know yet," Jones told a Dallas radio station.
"They (doctors) were concerned about any number of potential injuries but after an extensive night of tests, he's cleared to go," said Jones. "He had a long night. No sleep at all."
In his career, Smith has missed just one game due to injury and two because of a contract holdout.
Smith finished Monday night's game with 70 yards on 18 carries and caught two passes for five yards.
The Cowboys already were without two key players, suspended wide receiver Michael Irvin and injured tight end Jay Novacek.
